content.description: Climb easy face/slab on south side of pillar.
content.location: Misery Pillar is found in misery rock gully down slope  several hundred feet and slightly south on misery rocks.  Its about 100 feet north of Lincoln's chair buttress at the same level.

content.description: Start low on slopey pinch and make your may up into a mantle on small edges.  From there move into slopey edges in middle of boulder and toss right to good hold near corner.  Top-out.
content.location: North face of pillar.  If hiking down from Misery wall, stay right and traverse the talus field.  The pillar is on the right.

content.description: Start low in overhang and bust up to slopers.  Mantle into the crack and follow that up to top.  Heads up top-out!
content.protection: Pads and spotter if you have one.
content.location: NE side of pillar.  Pillar is down hill and south of Misery wall by about 200ft.

content.description: SDS below overhanging arete left of Pillar crack. climb though good holds to committing top out.
content.location: Misery Pillar is found in misery rock gully down slope  several hundred feet and slightly south on misery rocks.  Its about 100 feet north of Lincoln's chair buttress at the same level.

content.description:
A free-standing pillar, in the woods next to a boulder field.

 Also called "Misery Pillar", but closer to Lincoln's Chair and the the Pantry - finding Misery is just a useful way of locating this pillar.
